data.title: PA White Coat Ceremony
data.description: Please join EVMS as it welcomes the members of the PA Class of 2021. This special ceremony marks a student's entry as a junior colleague into the field of medicine.
data.full-description: Please join EVMS as it welcomes the members of the PA Class of 2021. This special ceremony marks a student's entry as a junior colleague into the field of medicine. Please note that students must arrive at 1:45 p.m. for rehearsal. Doors open for guests at 3:00 p.m. Ceremony will begin at 4:00 p.m. with a reception to follow.

data.title: Christmas Day
data.description: EVMS will be closed on Christmas Day on Tuesday, Dec. 25. Residents will follow their normal rotation schedule.

data.title: New Year's Day
data.description: EVMS will be closed on New Year's Day, Tuesday, Jan. 1. Residents will follow their normal rotation schedule.

start date: year is 2018, month is 12, day is 24

data.title: Christmas Eve
data.description: EVMS will be closed on Christmas Eve on Monday, Dec. 24. EVMS Medical Group will remain open for a half-day on Dec. 24. Residents will follow their normal rotation schedule.

data.title: Youth vaping now an epidemic, Surgeon General says
data.description: “Rethink Vape” is one way EVMS experts have worked to reduce teen vaping since 2015.

data.title: DoD picks EVMS expert to join epilepsy review panel
data.description: The Department of Defense has tapped an EVMS expert in epilepsy to join the peer review panel for its Epilepsy Research Program. Alberto Musto, MD, PhD, Associate Professor of Pathology and Anatomy, was chosen for his expertise in neuorophysiology, neuroradiology, traumatic brain injury and post-traumatic epilepsy.

data.title: Publication highlights EVMS expertise in autism spectrum disorders
data.description: The EVMS Program in Autism Spectrum Disorders has evaluated and treated over 1,000 persons referred from within and outside of coastal Virginia. And the world is taking notice.

data.title: Four ways to handle holiday stress
data.description: The holidays can be a hectic time. From a lack of money to a lack of time, many people feel stress, rather than joy, this time of year. But there are some simple ways to focus your emotions and efforts and have a more uplifting spirit this season, says Agatha Parks-Savage, EdD, RN, Assistant Dean of Graduate Medical Education and Associate Professor in the Department of Family and Community Medicine.

data.title: Waitzer Hall named for largest family gift ever made to EVMS
data.description: The Waitzers join EVMS’ founders and champions in changing the landscape of the campus and the region’s health.

data.title: Innovative ideas celebrated during Choosing Wisely Day
data.description: Thanks to everyone who helped make our inaugural EVMS Choosing Wisely Day a big success in November.

data.title: Faculty member chosen to review DoD medical research proposals
data.description: As a consumer reviewer, Dr. Cynthia Cadieux represented the voice of patients on important healthcare issues.

data.title: Regional health summit at EVMS focuses on health equity
data.description: Annual event drew 180 attendees and even had a waiting list.

data.title: Major NIH grant may advance kidney-cancer treatment
data.description: EVMS collaborator credits the school’s biorepository with key role in new research

data.title: Virginia Health Commissioner brings listening tour to EVMS
data.description: Campus community shared thoughts, posed questions about pressing public-health challenges.

data.title: Bank of America donates $500,000 toward new building
data.description: Bank of America has donated $500,000 in support of the education and academic administration building now under construction at EVMS. The gift helps with construction costs for the $80 million building that is scheduled to be completed in August 2020.

data.title: Faculty staff and students pledge to recycle
data.description: This week EVMS participated in America Recycles Day, a national initiative of Keep America Beautiful.

data.title: Are dark skin spots cause for concern
data.description: Age spots, sometimes called liver spots and solar lentigines, are small dark areas of increased pigmentation on your skin. While they often come with age, should they be a cause for concern?

data.title: Cut nearly 1,600 calories from your Thanksgiving feast
data.description: The goal of eating healthy tends to fly out the window when it comes to the holidays, but it doesn’t have to. You can still enjoy a delicious meal without consuming more than a day’s worth of calories in one sitting.

data.title: Research world turns to EVMS for study of peripheral nerve damage
data.description: A questionnaire developed by a husband-and-wife team at EVMS has become an invaluable tool for researchers around the globe as they work to find a treatment for peripheral nerve damage, a common side effect of diabetes.

data.title: Second edition of Acute Care Surgery hits the shelves
data.description: The textbook by Dr. L.D. Britt, the Edward J. Brickhouse Chair in Surgery, the Henry Ford Professor of Surgery and Professor and Chair of Surgery, is considered the foremost medical reference for acute care surgery.

data.title: Students give back during Community Impact Day
data.description: Cutting paper, pulling out staples and coloring bulletin boards might not be what you’d expect first-year medical and health professions students to be doing on a Saturday morning.

data.title: Dr. Britt inducted into inaugural academy of educators
data.description: L.D. Britt, MD, MPH, the Edward J. Brickhouse Chair in Surgery, the Henry Ford Professor of Surgery, and Chair and Professor of EVMS Surgery, was recently inducted into the inaugural class of the Academy of Master Surgeon Educators.

data.title: Stress and psoriasis
data.description: It can often seem like psoriasis surfaces at the worst time. That’s most likely because stress can actually cause a flare-up

data.title: EVMS Global Health joins partnership to tackle diabetes in Mexico
data.description: EVMS is proud to be a founding partner for the recently inaugurated Coalition for Diabetes Prevention in Guerrero, Mexico.

data.title: Award winners announced for 2018 Research Day
data.description: EVMS students, residents and fellows presented their work during Research Day on Oct. 12

data.title: Dr. Leader recognized among elite Hampton Roads professionals
data.description: Inside Business recently selected Dr. Alexandra Leader, Director of Global Health, as one of its ‘Top 40 Under 40’ for her leadership, achievements and community service.

data.title: Recall causes concern for ready-made foods
data.description: Millions of pounds of pre-made foods like salads, entrees, burritos and pizzas were recently recalled from supermarkets across the country, including Harris Teeter, Trader Joe’s, Kroger, Walmart and 7-Eleven.

data.title: Four Halloween hazards for your skin
data.description: ‌While Halloween costumes are fun, they can cause problems for your child’s skin. Here are a few things to think about before getting dressed up.

data.title: Research sheds new light on how the heart works
data.description: Two EVMS scientists continue to advance medicine’s understanding of how the heart works. In their latest research, collaborators Vitold Galkin, PhD, Associate Professor of Physiological Sciences, and Howard White, PhD, Professor of Physiological Sciences, report on their discovery of how key proteins interact to make the heart contract.

data.title: EVMS Development staff member honored
data.description: Serena Amerson, Executive Director of Major Gifts and Annual Giving at EVMS, has been named the 2018 Outstanding Fundraising Professional by the Association of Fundraising Professionals, Hampton Roads Chapter.

data.title: New report finds one age group at particular risk during a crash
data.description: As part of Child Passenger Safety Week, the 2017 National Survey of the Use of Booster Seats (NSUBS) released its report on restraint use and found concerning results around tweens.

data.title: New York medical school taps EVMS physician/scientist as new dean
data.description: Jerry Nadler, MD, a veteran medical educator, widely respected administrator and a former scientist of the year in Virginia, will soon take on a new role: leadership of a medical school. In March 2019, Dr. Nadler will leave EVMS to become Dean of the New York Medical College School of Medicine in Valhalla, New York.

data.title: Discover the subtle signs of ovarian cancer
data.description: Some call it a silent killer. That’s because the symptoms of ovarian cancer often go undetected until it’s too late.

data.title: Dr. Counselman accepted into AAMC leadership development program
data.description: Francis Counselman, MD, (MD ’83, Emergency Medicine Residency ’86), the Chidester Endowed Chair of Emergency Medicine and Professor and Chair of Emergency Medicine, is one of five faculty members nationwide accepted into a leadership training program sponsored by the Council of Deans at the Association of American Medical Colleges.

data.title: Governor’s Grand Rounds at EVMS tackles Virginia’s opioid crisis
data.description: Recovering addict recounts his story during Gov. Ralph Northam’s presentation.

data.title: EVMS community comes out in force for FOHTA day camps
data.description: More than 50 faculty members, residents and students volunteer for two days of S.T.E.A.M.M. summer camps

data.title: New students on campus this week
data.description: Expect to see new faces on campus this week as EVMS Institutional Orientation begins Thursday, Aug. 9.

data.title: EVMS, Sentara combine to earn high rating in diabetes care
data.description: Sentara Healthcare and EVMS specialists in diabetes are celebrating the latest hospital rankings from U.S. News & World Report. The Diabetes and Endocrinology program at Sentara Norfolk General Hospital — staffed by EVMS physicians — earned a spot in the top 50 programs for the third straight year.

data.title: Health fairs support local Hispanic and refugee communities
data.description: EVMS faculty, residents, students, alumni and community partners came together recently to provide physicals and assistance with back-to-school forms for more than 100 children in local immigrant and refugee communities.

data.title: Sentara triples support to EVMS with $130 million agreement
data.description: Sentara Healthcare announced today that it will triple its financial support for EVMS with a commitment of $130 million over the next five years. For the period 2018 through 2023, annual funding given by Sentara to EVMS will increase from a previous amount of $9 million per year to $26 million per year.

data.title: Elza Mylona elected to national leadership role in faculty affairs
data.description: Elza Mylona, PhD, MBA, Vice Provost for Faculty Affairs and Institutional Effectiveness, is in line to assume one of the nation’s top posts in faculty affairs.

data.title: Anne Shumadine, first female rector, has died
data.description: Anne Shumadine, the first female Rector of EVMS, has died. “She was a renowned community leader, businessperson and role model for all those who were privileged to know and work with her,” said Richard Homan, MD, EVMS President and Provost and Dean of the School of Medicine.

data.title: Patients saving fat for future use
data.description: In the quest for youth and beauty, one of the growing trends gaining attention is using fat for cosmetic purposes.

data.title: Flesh-eating bacteria kills Virginia man
data.description: Health officials are warning coastal residents and visitors to be careful after a waterborne bacteria called vibrio killed an Eastern Virginia man.

data.title: Professional Enrichment and Growth grants awarded
data.description: EVMS Faculty Affairs and Professional Development has awarded Professional Enrichment and Growth (PEG) grants to 17 faculty members for the 2018-2019 academic year.

data.title: International Medical Graduates attend boot camp at EVMS
data.description: Did you know more than 25 percent of all physicians in the U.S. went to medical school outside the United States? At EVMS, international medical graduates (IMGs) make up about 22 percent of residents and fellows.

data.title: Phase 1 of Website Refresh Project launched
data.description: The first phase implements a new, more visually appealing design and includes more opportunities for interactivity.

data.title: Soaring temperatures mean health risks
data.description: The heat is on and Hampton Roads is feeling the burn, triggering the National Weather Service to issue heat index advisories. Do you know how to handle the heat and avoid sun-related illnesses like heat exhaustion and heat stroke?

image.alt: woman drinking water in the sun

data.title: Faculty member honored at hometown university in China
data.description: Wenxia (Joy) Wu, PhD, Assistant Professor in the School of Health Professions was recently honored as Visiting Professor by Southwest Medical University (SWMU) in Luzhou, China.

data.title: Study might lead to surprising new use for Botox
data.description: Most people use Botox to remove lines and wrinkles on their skin. Others use it to reduce perspiration or even to ease migraines. But there’s a new use that’s getting attention.

data.title: Women in leadership event inspires team building
data.description: The energy in the room was palpable when Luanne Thorndyke, MD, spent the day with over 70 EVMS faculty members at the 2nd Annual EVMS Women in Medicine and Science event.

data.title: New grant spurs study of potential epilepsy treatment
data.description: An EVMS physician/scientist has won grant funding to continue his study of the link between inflammation and seizures. It's part of his work to find a treatment for epilepsy.

data.title: Tacky Sweater 5k
data.description: The Tacky Sweater 5K raises money for EVMS Dermatology and the Dermatology Student Group.

data.title: EVMS Diabetes Screening at Onelife Fitness
data.description: The EVMS Strelitz Diabetes Center partnered with the Cosmopolitan Club of Norfolk and Onelife Fitness for a free diabetes screening.

data.title: Thank you, Bank of America
data.description: EVMS students thank Bank of America for their $500,000 donation to go towards classroom expansion.

data.title: EVMS Waitzer Hall Announcement
data.description: At the Association of Fundraising Professionals National Philanthropy Day Luncheon, Leah and Richard Waitzer were honored with the Outstanding Philanthropists Award. Upon receiving the award, it was announced the couple is donating the newest building at EVMS will be named Waitzer Hall.

data.title: Anatomy Night with Medical Adventures
data.description: Through the Medical Adventures program, first year medical students led area high school students through an exploration of the human body in the anatomy lab.

data.title: Haunted Hallway 2018
data.description: On October 25th, as part of community engagement, EVMS students gave local children a safe place to trick-or-treat during their annual Haunted Hallway event.

data.title: 4th Annual Pumpkin Bowl
data.description: The game is a 7 v 7 Powderpuff flag-football tournament (that means females only). MD students as well as students from the School of Health Professions participated.

data.title: Physician Assistant Community Impact Day
data.description: The Physician Assistant Class of 2020 helped out Saturday, Oct. 6, at the Young Terrace Community Center for the third annual PA Community Impact Day.

data.title: Keisha Earl: Scholarship Story
data.description: The power of scholarships is that they change lives. Here is the story of pathologists' assistant student, Keisha Earl.

data.title: Dr. Strasnick explains how a Cochlear Implant works
data.description: Dr. Strasnick explains how a Cochlear Implant works by bypassing damaged portions of the ear and directly stimulating the auditory nerve. Signals generated by the implant are sent by way of the auditory nerve to the brain, which recognizes the signals as sound.

data.title: President's Picnic 2018
data.description: Every year during orientation week we host a picnic with the President. It's always good times, good food, and good music! Enjoy this short montage of the event.

data.title: My Story: Hunley Twins
data.description: “Everything was easy for us early in our relationship,” Eric says. “So the natural progression was OK, let’s have a baby. And we thought that would go just as easily.” Watch their story on the quest to have children, with the help the Jones Institute for Reproductive Medicine at EVMS.

data.title: 2018 Community Impact Day
data.description: Big opportunities can come from the smallest of moments. We hope the time our students spent at PB Young Elementary School will be the spark of something great for every child who walks through those doors.

data.title: MD White Coat Ceremony Class of 2022
data.description: On Friday, August 17, the Class of 2022 donned their white coats for the first time. Here is the video wrap up from the event.

data.title: Governor Ralph Northam, MD and the opioid crisis
data.description: This addiction problem starts with a prescription from someone like you or me," Governor and EVMS alumnus Dr. Ralph Northam says of the opioid crisis in the Commonwealth.

data.title: Orientation Day at EVMS
data.description: Big opportunities can come from the smallest of moments. We hope the time our students spent at PB Young Elementary School will be the spark of something great for every child who walks through those doors.

data.title: The next step in Baby Charly’s hearing journey (Part 2)
data.description: When baby Charly was born, she failed her newborn screening test. Her mother, Christy Keane, initially thought it was a fluke, but after several additional tests she learned Charly was profoundly deaf. Watch the latest on her journey.

data.title: From One Hand To AnOTHER Summer STEAMM Camp
data.description: For the second year in a row, From One Hand To AnOTHER partnered with EVMS to bring a S.T.E.A.M.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math and Motivation) day camp to local students. Over the course of two days, campers were educated and entertained by more than 50 EVMS faculty members, residents and students who volunteered to participate.

data.title: This is Hampton Roads
data.description: Eastern Virginia, Coastal Virginia, Hampton Roads, whatever you want to call it—the seven cities that make up this region have a wide array of activities to entertain and delight just about anyone.

data.title: My Story: Russ Clark
data.description: Russ Clark isn't waiting until he dies to give his body to science. He's breathing life into the MD and HP curricula today. Watch his story on a unique form of volunteerism at EVMS.

data.title: Behind The Bench - Dr. Kelli Will
data.description: Through her work in risk communication, Dr. Will knows the life-or-death difference social media can make. A member of the Community Health and Research team in EVMS Pediatrics, she designs and evaluates behavior-change programs that improve the health and safety of children and teens.

data.title: GME Coordinator of the Year
data.description: Congratulations to this year's Graduate Medical Education Coordinator of the Year, Audra Mitchell. Faculty and residents nominated Ms. Mitchell for her dedication to EVMS Obstetrics & Gynecology.

data.title: Emergency Medicine residents challenge their skills
data.description: ER Residents at Sentara Norfolk General Hospital put their skills to the test in the Level 1 Trauma Center.

data.title: EVMS names rotunda in honor of Beazley Foundation
data.description: Judge Richard Bray, President and CEO of the Beazley Foundation in Portsmouth, joined fellow foundation trustees Nov. 15 as EVMS renamed its rotunda in honor of the foundation. More than 200 students, faculty and staff were on hand to celebrate. The Beazley Foundation has been one of the school’s most loyal supporters.

data.title: EVMS celebrates excellence, longevity at annual awards ceremony
data.description: Clarence Johnson, left, and Charlene Cooper, both 40 year employees, celebrate their achievement with EVMS President Richard Homan at the school's 2018 Service and Recognition Awards ceremony Oct. 30. View more photos from the event.

data.title: EVMS Dermatology Residency
data.description: The Dermatology Residency Program at EVMS combines patient care, research and education to help physicians become leaders in the field.

data.title: EVMS Haunted Hallway
data.description: EVMS students gave more than 700 children a safe place to trick-or-treat during their annual Haunted Hallway event on Oct. 25.

data.title: PA week 2018
data.description: This week EVMS' Master of Physician Assistant Program is celebrating National PA Week, which recognizes the role that 100,000 practicing PAs play in delivering efficient, effective health care.

data.title: Heart of Ghent 10k
data.description: Dozens of students, faculty and staff woke up early on a Saturday morning to show their support for EVMS in the Heart of Ghent 10k.

data.title: Healthcare Sim Week 2018
data.description: The EVMS Sentara Center for Simulation & Immersive Learning is celebrating Healthcare SimWeek 2018.  The week aims to bring greater awareness about how healthcare simulation is leading us to safer, more knowledgeable patient care.

data.title: Orientation II
data.description: EVMS welcomed 69 students in Art Therapy & Counseling, Public Health and Surgical Assisting programs during Orientation II in August.

data.title: Students tour Service Learning Fair
data.description: MD and Health Professions students spent the day learning about all of the service-learning programs EVMS has to offer.

data.title: EVMS Orientation I 2018
data.description: EVMS Orientation I kicked off on Thursday, Aug. 9 with 335 new students in the Doctor of Medicine program, Biotechnology, Pathologists’ Assistant and Biomedical Sciences (Medical Master’s, PhD and Research).

data.title: From One Hand to Another summer camp
data.description: EVMS teamed up with the organization From One Hand to Another again this summer to put on a day camp designed to expose kids to careers in health and medicine.

image.alt: Kids at From One Hand to Another summer camp

data.title: 2018 Community Care Day
data.description: EVMS Student Government Association hosts Community Care Day at Military Circle Mall in Norfolk. Students offered important health screenings free of charge.

data.title: New Resident and Fellow Orientation
data.description: A big welcome to our new residents and fellows! In all, 101 residents and 25 fellows are beginning the next step of their medical education with EVMS.
